The Marist House Cup

Presented by the Class of 2020

Design

Sed ut summum malum et, quantum possit, a se texit, ne ferae quidem faciunt, ut alterum esse ratione intellegi posse et dolorum effugiendorum gratia ut de voluptate velit esse, quam nihil ut calere ignem, nivem esse albam, dulce mel quorum nihil ut perspiciatis, unde.

Materials

The Marist House Cup boats an impressive collection of fine materials ranging from rare metals to rich treated woods. Each material has been selected to best suit the need of each of the cup’s components.

Rhodium

Derived from the Greek word ‘rhodon’, meaning ‘rose’, rhodium is one of the rarest and arguably most beautiful metals on the Earth. It is used for the plating of the House Cup.

Stainless Steel

Named after its anti-corrosive nature, stainless steel is a visually appealing metal with extreme durability. It is the metal of choice for the House Cup’s signature ‘Ave Maria’ centerpiece.

High-Gloss Rosewood

Known for its rich hue, Rosewood is a high quality wood used in high-end products. The House Cup’s base is made from solid rosewood coated in a distinct high-gloss finish.
